title: How to keep zoom screen sharing audio consistent - Quora

response.answer_text: You cannot. The Internet does its best to deliver packets, but the protocols do not guarantee packets arrive in a specific order. Documents and web pages don’t care which part arrives first. Movies buffer packets, which is why you have to wait for them to start. This won’t help zoom either. The only way is for zoom to “mark” it’s packets as “high priority”. It requires extra hardware to deliver packets by priority. Most Internet Providers will not buy the extra hardware unless zoom pays them which zoom cannot do unless they charge users.

You don't. Zoom uses automatic volume leveling to try and keep voices at an intelligible level, it also treats music as background noise and tries to block it. Its designed for business conferencing, its optimised for that.
